title: Hardware Requirements & Lab Setup
description:
## Learning Objectives
 Understand the minimum and recommended hardware specifications for Physical AI development.
 Learn how to set up a Digital Twin workstation for simulation and development.
 Explore various robotic hardware kits Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, ROS 2, NVIDIA drivers, Docker, preferred IDE (VS Code).
 Hardware
         CPU NVIDIA RTX 3070/4070 or higher (8GB+ VRAM)
         RAM 1TB NVMe SSD
         OS
         Jetson AGX Orin or Orin Nano (for edge deployment)
         SD card (128GB+)
         Power supply
     Sensors
         Unitree Go1/Go2 (bipedal/quadrupedal)
         Humanoid robot platform (e.g., open-source projects or commercial small humanoids)

## Hands-on Labs
### Lab 13.1 Follow provided scripts to install NVIDIA drivers, Docker, and ROS 2 on Ubuntu.
 Activity Fully functional Digital Twin workstation ready for Physical AI development.

## Sim-to-Real Bridge
 Concept: A well-configured Digital Twin workstation with powerful GPUs is essential for both high-fidelity simulation and for deploying and testing AI models on real hardware.

## Quiz / Reflection Questions
1. What are the key components of a Digital Twin workstation and why are they important for Physical AI?
2. Compare and contrast the use cases for a Jetson Orin Developer Kit versus a high-end desktop GPU.
3. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of using cloud computing for robotics simulation.
